body: Thank you for reporting the issue. Please provide the procedure to reproduce at first.
@icoxfog417 , just `$ /opt/docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up` twice. You'll see it the second time. Oh, yes: turn on `debug` first.

rename.to: [Enhancement request] Avoid api_role_name_key duplicate key value error on launching

body:
@icoxfog417 , about changing the title: not only that, see last lines.
```
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] ERROR:  duplicate key value violates unique constraint "auth_user_username_key"
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] DETAIL:  Key (username)=(admin) already exists.
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] STATEMENT:  INSERT INTO "auth_user" ("password", "last_login", "is_superuser", "username", "first_name", "last_name", "email", "is_staff", "is_active", "date_joined") VALUES ('<...>', NULL, true, 'admin', '', '', 'admin@example.com', true, true, '2020-03-04T05:34:32.023520+00:00'::timestamptz) RETURNING "auth_user"."id"
backend_1   | User admin already exists.
```

rename.from: [Enhancement request] Avoid api_role_name_key duplicate key value error on launching
rename.to: [Enhancement request] Avoid duplicate key value error on launching

issue.title: [Enhancement request] Settling superuser's password change

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
According to #622 ,
1. Setting `ADMIN_USERNAME` and `ADMIN_PASSWORD` Docker Compose's variables works on first start *only*.
2. To change superuser's  password I have to use Django Admin.

So I propose **to reflect this information on Wiki or/and Read Me**.

Also according to https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/589#issuecomment-599202172, we have strange code and/or bug in this method:
```
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] ERROR:  duplicate key value violates unique constraint "auth_user_username_key"
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] DETAIL:  Key (username)=(admin) already exists.
postgres_1  | 2020-03-04 05:34:32.026 UTC [28] STATEMENT:  INSERT INTO "auth_user" ("password", "last_login", "is_superuser", "username", "first_name", "last_name", "email", "is_staff", "is_active", "date_joined") VALUES ('<...>', NULL, true, 'admin', '', '', 'admin@example.com', true, true, '2020-03-04T05:34:32.023520+00:00'::timestamptz) RETURNING "auth_user"."id"
backend_1   | User admin already exists.
```
https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/bdba2961bf7942eb529a1591a7499b5d15af73bf/app/server/management/commands/create_admin.py#L14-L31
First of all (see that comment), that code doesn't change the superuser's password.
Secondly, attempt to do it contradicts p.2.

So I also propose **to settle these mechanisms**.

Thanks!

body:
Hi,

I used the Azure deploy option and I'm getting this error. The system was running for a few months and now it just crashes with this error:

`2020-08-09T10:27:06.215758024Z   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/backends/utils.py", line 85, in _execute
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215766524Z     return self.cursor.execute(sql, params)
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215774625Z   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/utils.py", line 89, in __exit__
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215790325Z     raise dj_exc_value.with_traceback(traceback) from exc_value
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215799126Z   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/backends/utils.py", line 85, in _execute
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215807426Z     return self.cursor.execute(sql, params)
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215815426Z django.db.utils.IntegrityError: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "auth_user_username_key"
2020-08-09T10:27:06.215824427Z DETAIL:  Key (username)=(dsadmin) already exists.`

I'm using the latest image. Any tips?

Thanks.

issue.title: IntegrityError occurs when deploy to Azure

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Used the azure deploy and was working fine until recently, I started getting the following error. The error repeats when i try to restart the container.

Container xxxxxxxxxxx  couldn't be started: Logs = 2020-09-02T06:20:16.887355503Z Operations to perform:
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887396106Z   Apply all migrations: admin, api, auth, authtoken, contenttypes, sessions, social_django
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887403706Z Running migrations:
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887408307Z   No migrations to apply.
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887412907Z   Your models have changes that are not yet reflected in a migration, and so won't be applied.
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887417707Z   Run 'manage.py makemigrations' to make new migrations, and then re-run 'manage.py migrate' to apply them.
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362115634Z Traceback (most recent call last):
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362139736Z   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/backends/utils.py", line 85, in _execute
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362145936Z     return self.cursor.execute(sql, params)
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362151036Z psycopg2.IntegrityError: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "auth_user_username_key"
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362156137Z DETAIL:  Key (username)=(doccanoadmin) already exists.

Your Environment
---------
Azure Deploy

Temp hack to get it working after deployment and for getting existing projects to appear
Goto "Hosted Doccano Azure Web App" -> Configuration -> "ADMIN_USERNAME" -> and make the value empty and that should bypass the above error

Note: I am unsure in all the other places that this "ADMIN_USERNAME" is used so by doing the above, you might end up breaking it in other places
